page.title: 18 Wellow's Timber Man
page.content: The timber man buys the wood himself from an area stretching from Andover to Bournemouth, other parts of Dorset, to the Isle of Wight.The timber man buys all species of wood apart from Corsican Pine and Japanese Larch which are very soft woods.The base of the trees vary from three inches to six feet.No labourers are required,motor saws are used.There is no restriction on buying certain amounts of wood,the prices are low so little profit is made.No advertising is involved and people have to pick up the supplies themselves.The sales depend largely on the weather.The products are raspberry canes,swings, patio fencing materials,fire wood and stub posts. By Amanda Wainwright,Philippa Green, Jenni Welsh
